sen.j: 子嶋寺（こじまでら）は奈良県高市郡高取町にある高野山真言宗の寺院。
sen.e: Kojima-dera Temple is a temple of Shingon sect located in Takatori-cho Takaichi-gun Nara Prefecture.
Kojima-dera Temple is a temple of the Shingon sect located in Takatori-cho, Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: ・sectは可算名詞ですので定冠詞を付けました。・住所のコンマが抜けていました。
sen.e: Kojima-dera Temple is a temple of the Shingon sect located in Takatori-cho, Takaichi-gun, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 山号は子嶋山（報恩山とも）。
sen.e: The sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple is Kojimasan (Houonzan).
The sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple is Kojimasan (Houonzan).
The sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple is Kojimasan (Houonzan).

sen.j: 本尊は大日如来。
sen.e: The principle object of worship at a temple is Dainichi Nyorai (Mahavairocana).
The principal image at a temple is Dainichi Nyorai (Mahavairocana).
sen.cmt: 「本尊」は用語集の訳語に合わせました。
sen.e: The principal image at a temple is Dainichi Nyorai (Mahavairocana).

sen.j: 開山は寺伝では僧・報恩と伝える。
sen.e: The temple legend says the founder of the temple is a monk, Houon.
The temple legend says the founder of the temple is a monk, Houon.
The temple legend says the founder of the temple is a monk, Houon.

sen.j: 平安時代中期作の国宝・両界曼荼羅図（子島曼荼羅）を伝えることで知られる。
sen.e: It is famous for Ryokai mandara (mandara of the Two Realms) or Kojima mandara which was created in the middle of the Heian period and has been designated a national treasure.
It is famous for Ryokai mandara (mandara of the Two Realms) or Kojima mandara which was created in the middle of the Heian period and has been designated a national treasure.
It is famous for Ryokai mandara (mandala of the Two Realms) or Kojima mandala which was created in the middle of the Heian period and has been designated a national treasure.
sen.cmt: Mandara→Mandala（統一リストにあわせました）

sen.j: 「清水の舞台」で知られる京都東山の清水寺は子嶋寺の僧・延鎮によって開かれたとされている。
sen.e: Kiyomizu-dera Temple known as 'Kyomizu no butai (the stage of Kiyomizu) was reportedly founded by the monk of Kojima-dera Temple, Enchin.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Kiyomizu-dera Temple known as 'Kyomizu no butai (the stage of Kiyomizu) was reportedly founded by the monk of Kojima-dera Temple, Enchin.
Kiyomizu-dera Temple known as 'Kyomizu no butai (the stage of Kiyomizu) was reportedly founded by the monk of Kojima-dera Temple, Enchin.

sen.j: 平安時代中期以降は真言宗子嶋流の道場として栄えるなど、歴史的に重要な寺院である。
sen.e: Historically, Kojima-dera Temple played an important role having a training hall for Kojima school of the Shingon sect since the middle of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Historically, Kojima-dera Temple played an important role having a training hall for Kojima school of the Shingon sect since the middle of the Heian period.
Historically, Kojima-dera Temple played an important role having a training hall for Kojima school of the Shingon sect since the middle of the Heian period.

sen.j: 大和七福神（信貴山朝護孫子寺、久米寺、子嶋寺、小房観音寺、談山神社、當麻寺中之坊、安倍文殊院）のひとつ。
sen.e: It is one of Yamato Shichifukujin or the Seven Deities of Good Fortune in Yamato (shinkisan chogo sonshi-ji Temple, Kume-dera Temple, Kojima-dera Temple, Ofusa Kannon-ji Temple, Tanzan-jinja Shrine and Taima-dera Temple Nakanobo and Abe Monjuin).

It is one of Yamato Shichifukujin or the Seven Deities of Good Fortune in Yamato (Shinkisan Chogo Sonshi-ji Temple, Kume-dera Temple, Kojima-dera Temple, Ofusa Kannon-ji Temple, Tanzan-jinja Shrine, Taima-dera Temple Nakanobo and Abe Monjuin).
sen.cmt: ・「信貴山朝護孫子寺」のスペルは、固有名詞のため頭文字を大文字にしました。・括弧内にandが2つあったので1つにしました。
sen.e: It is one of Yamato Shichifukujin or the Seven Deities of Good Fortune in Yamato (Shinkisan Chogo Sonshi-ji Temple, Kume-dera Temple, Kojima-dera Temple, Ofusa Kannon-ji Temple, Tanzan-jinja Shrine, Taima-dera Temple Nakanobo and Abe Monjuin).

sen.j: 奈良時代以前の創建を伝えるが、草創の時期や経緯については複数の説がある。
sen.e: Although it is said it was founded before the Nara period, there are several views about the time of foundation and circumstances behind it.
Although it is said it was founded before the Nara period, there are several views about the time of foundation and circumstances behind it.
Although it is said it was founded before the Nara period, there are several views about the time of foundation and circumstances behind it.

sen.j: 現在の子嶋寺は近鉄壺阪山駅近くにある。
sen.e: The current Kojima-dera Temple is located near Tsubosakayama station of Kintetsu line.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The current Kojima-dera Temple is located near Tsubosakayama station of Kintetsu line.
The current Kojima-dera Temple is located near Tsubosakayama station of Kintetsu line.

sen.j: しかし、各種史料に「子嶋山寺」と見えるところからも、創建当時は山間部に位置していたと思われる。
sen.e: However, as some historical materials suggested the name, 'Kojimayama-dera', its original location seems to have been between mountains.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, as some historical materials suggested the name, 'Kojimayama-dera', its original location seems to have been between mountains.
However, as some historical materials suggested the name, 'Kojimasan-dera', its original location seems to have been between mountains.
sen.cmt: 子嶋山はこじまさんと呼ぶようなので、Kojimayama-dera→Kojimasan-deraとしました。（参照）http://www.bell.jp/pancho/k_diary-2/2008_11_26.htm

sen.j: 平安時代中期には一時衰退し、興福寺の僧・真興（しんごう）によって中興された。
sen.e: It fell into a decline in the middle of the Heian period, but a monk, Shingo who served in Kofuku-ji Temple revitalized it.
It fell into a decline in the middle of the Heian period, but a monk, Shingo, who served in Kofuku-ji Temple, revitalized it.
sen.cmt: ShingoとTempleの後にはコンマが必要です。
sen.e: It fell into a decline in the middle of the Heian period, but a monk, Shingo, who served in Kofuku-ji Temple, revitalized it.

sen.j: 寺号は古くは子嶋寺または子嶋山寺、真興による中興以降は「観覚寺」となった。
sen.e: In terms of jigo (literally, 'temple name'), which is the title given to a Buddhist temple, in early times, it was Kojima-dera or Kojimayama-dera Temple, but since its revitalization by Shingo, it became 'Kankaku-ji Temple'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Its jigo (literally, 'temple name'), which is the title given to a Buddhist temple, was Kojima-dera or Kojimayama-dera Temple in early times, but after its revitalization by Shingo, it was changed to 'Kankaku-ji Temple.'
sen.cmt: ・前半は冗長なため、SVC構文にしました。・ピリオドは引用符の中に入るため、修正しました。・in early timesの係り先が不明瞭なため修正しました。・sinceとbecameのつながりが悪いため、afterとwas changed toにしました。
sen.e: Its jigo (literally, 'temple name'), which is the title given to a Buddhist temple, was Kojima-dera or Kojimayama-dera Temple in early times, but after its revitalization by Shingo, it was changed to 'Kankaku-ji Temple.'

sen.j: そして、近世には「千寿院」と称されたが、近代に入って「子嶋寺」に復称した。
sen.e: In modern times, it was changed to 'Senju-in' and then, currently, it became 'Kojima-dera' again.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In modern times, it was changed to 'Senju-in' and then it became 'Kojima-dera' again.
sen.cmt: currentlyはthenやbecameと合わないため削除しました。
sen.e: In modern times, it was changed to 'Senju-in' and then it became 'Kojima-dera' again.

sen.j: 子嶋寺付近の地名を「高取町大字観覚寺」というのは旧寺号に由来する。
sen.e: The place around Kojima-dera Temple is named 'Takatori-cho oaza Kankaku-ji Temple', originating in the previous jigo.
The name of the place around Kojima-dera Temple, 'Oaza Kankaku-ji, Takatori-cho,' originates in the previous jigo.
sen.cmt: ．「～に由来する」が重要情報ですので、補足説明ではなくメインの部分に変えました。・地名は住所ですので、住所の書き方に変えました。
sen.e: The name of the place around Kojima-dera Temple, 'Oaza Kankaku-ji, Takatori-cho,' originates in the previous jigo.

sen.j: 創建の事情についてもっとも流布している説は『元亨釈書』の吉野山報恩伝、『本朝高僧伝』の報恩伝などに見える説である。
sen.e: The prevailing view about circumstances behind its foundation was written in some materials such as Yoshinosan Hoon den (the record of Hoon Daishi of the Yoshino-san Temple) of "Genko Shakusho" (History of Buddhism of the Genko era) and Hoon den of "Honcho Kosoden" (biography of high ranking monks).

The prevailing view about circumstances behind its foundation was written in some materials such as Yoshinosan Hoon den (the record of Hoon Daishi of the Yoshino-san Temple) of "Genko Shakusho" (History of Buddhism of the Genko era) and Hoon den of "Honcho Kosoden" (biography of high ranking monks).

The prevailing view about circumstances behind its foundation was written in some materials such as Yoshinosan Hoon den (the record of Hoon Daishi of the Yoshino-san Temple) of "Genko Shakusho" (History of Buddhism of the Genko era) and Hoon den of "Honcho Kosoden" (biography of high ranking monks).

sen.j: これは、天平宝字4年（760年）、孝謙天皇の勅願により、僧報恩が大和国高市郡の「子嶋神祠のほとり」に子嶋山寺を建てたとするものである。
sen.e: These materials described that in 760, a monk, Hoon founded Kojimayama-dera 'near Kojima Shrine' in Takaichi-gun Yamoto no kuni (Yamato Province) by order from the Emperor Koken.
These materials described that in 760, a monk, Hoon, founded Kojimayama-dera Temple 'near Kojima Shrine' in Takaichi-gun Yamoto no kuni (Yamato Province) by order from the Emperor Koken.
sen.cmt: ・Hoonの後には挿入句を閉じるコンマが必要です。・用語統一に従ってKojimayama-deraにTempleを付け加えました。
sen.e: These materials described that in 760, a monk, Hoon, founded Kojimasan-dera Temple 'near Kojima Shrine' in Takaichi-gun Yamoto no kuni (Yamato Province) by order from the Emperor Koken.

sen.j: この「子嶋神祠」は現在、高取町下子島（子嶋寺の南方）にある小島神社を指すものと思われる。
sen.e: This 'Kojima Shrine' seems to indicate present-day Kojima Shrine located in Shimokojima Takatori-cho (the south of Kojima-dera).
This 'Kojima Shrine' seems to indicate present-day Kojima Shrine located in Shimokojima, Takatori-cho (the south of Kojima-dera).
sen.cmt: Shimokojimaの後にはコンマが必要と思われます。
sen.e: This 'Kojima Shrine' seems to indicate present-day Kojima Shrine located in Shimokojima, Takatori-cho (the south of Kojima-dera).

sen.j: 創建年は寺伝では天平勝宝4年（752年）ともいう。
sen.e: The temple legend described the temple was founded in 752.
The temple legend described the temple was founded in 752.
The temple legend described the temple was founded in 752.

sen.j: 一方、『日本書紀』の皇極天皇3年（644年、大化の改新の前年）11月条には「蘇我蝦夷が大丹穂山（おおにほやま）に桙削寺（ほこのきでら）を建てた」との記事がある。
sen.e: On the other hand, the article of November, 644 (this was previous year of the Taika Reforms) of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) suggested that SOGA no Emishi founded Hokonoki-dera Temple in Mt. Oniho.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On the other hand, the article of November, 644 (this was the year before the Taika Reforms) of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) suggested that SOGA no Emishi founded Hokonoki-dera Temple on Mt. Oniho.
sen.cmt: ・「前年」はpreviousでは幅があるため、厳密に「前年」と指す表現にしました。・Mt. Onihoは前置詞がonと思われます。
sen.e: On the other hand, the article of November, 644 (this was the year before the Taika Reforms) of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) suggested that SOGA no Emishi founded Hokonoki-dera Temple on Mt. Oniho.

sen.j: それゆえ、この「桙削寺」の後身が子嶋寺であるとする説がある。
sen.e: So, there is another view that this 'Hokonoki-dera Temple' was the predecessor of Kojima-dera Temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: So, there is another view that this 'Hokonoki-dera Temple' was the predecessor of Kojima-dera Temple.
So, there is another view that this 'Hokonoki-dera Temple' was the predecessor of Kojima-dera Temple.

sen.j: この説を取れば、子嶋寺の創建時期は1世紀以上さかのぼることになる。
sen.e: According to this view, the foundation of Kojima-dera Temple dates back more than one century than the temple legend suggested.
According to this view, the foundation of Kojima-dera Temple dates back more than one century from the date the temple legend suggested.
sen.cmt: thanは比較の意味で使うもので、この文ではfromが適切と思われます。
sen.e: According to this view, the foundation of Kojima-dera Temple dates back more than one century from the date the temple legend suggested.

sen.j: また、『延暦僧録』「長岡天皇菩薩伝」には、延暦年間（8世紀末）、桓武天皇が南京丹恵山（「丹穂山」の誤りか）に「子嶋山寺」を建立したとの記事もある。
sen.e: Additionally, 'Nagaoka tenno Bosatsu den' (life of the Emperor Nagaoka Bodhisattva) in "Enryaku so roku" (the record of monks in Enryaku) described that during the eighth century, the Emperor Kanmu founded Kojima-dera Temple at Mt. Nie (Niho?) in Nanjin.
sen.cmt: 南京丹恵山（「丹穂山」の誤りか） を 「at Mt. Nie (Niho?) in Nanjin」としました。
sen.e: Additionally, 'Nagaoka tenno Bosatsu den' (life of the Emperor Nagaoka Bodhisattva) in "Enryaku so roku" (the record of monks in Enryaku) described that in the end of the eighth century, the Emperor Kanmu founded Kojima-dera Temple at Mt. Nie (Niho?) in Nanjin.
sen.cmt: 「8世紀末」がduring the eighth century(8世紀の間に)となっていましたので、修正しました。
sen.e: Additionally, 'Nagaoka tenno Bosatsu den' (life of the Emperor Nagaoka Bodhisattva) in "Enryaku so roku" (the record of monks in Enryaku) described that in the end of the eighth century, the Emperor Kanmu founded Kojimasan-dera Temple at Mt. Nie (Niho?) in Nanjin.

sen.j: 大丹穂山は、現在の高取町丹生谷に比定されるが、明日香村入谷（にゅうだに）とする説もある。
sen.e: Mt. Oniho is considered to be either present-day Takatori-cho Nyudani or Asuka-cho Nyudani.
Mt. Oniho is considered to be either present-day Nyudani, Takatori-cho or Nyudani, Asuka-cho.
sen.cmt: 住所は記載順番が小から大になると思われます。
sen.e: Mt. Oniho is considered to be either present-day Nyudani, Takatori-cho or Nyudani, Asuka-cho.

sen.j: 平安初期には長谷寺と壺阪寺に次ぐ大和国の観音霊場として栄えた。
sen.e: During the early Heian period, it was thriving as a Kanno reijo (sacred place with Kannon statue) following Hase-dera Temple and Tsubosaka-dera Temple.
During the early Heian period, it was thriving as a Kannon reijo (sacred place with Kannon statue) following Hase-dera Temple and Tsubosaka-dera Temple.
sen.cmt: Kannonの後のnが抜けていました。
sen.e: During the early Heian period, it was thriving as a Kannon reijo (sacred place with Kannon statue) following Hase-dera Temple and Tsubosaka-dera Temple.

sen.j: 京都・清水寺は、子嶋寺二世延鎮と坂上田村麻呂により子嶋寺の支坊として開かれた。
sen.e: The second chief priest of Kojima-dera Temple, Enchin and SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro founded Kiyomizu-dera Temple in Kyoto as a branch temple of Kojima-dera Temple.
The second chief priest of Kojima-dera Temple, Enchin, and SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro founded Kiyomizu-dera Temple in Kyoto as a branch temple of Kojima-dera Temple.
sen.cmt: Enchinの後にはコンマが必要と思われます。
sen.e: The second chief priest of Kojima-dera Temple, Enchin, and SAKANOUE no Tamuramaro founded Kiyomizu-dera Temple in Kyoto as a branch temple of Kojima-dera Temple.

sen.j: 『今昔物語』等に取り上げられている清水寺開創伝承によれば、清水寺は子嶋寺の僧・延鎮（賢心）が霊夢を得て音羽の滝にたどりつき、千手観音を祀って開創したものである（『今昔物語』には「小島山寺」と見える）。
sen.e: According to tradition about the foundation of Kiyomizu-dera Temple described in some historical materials such as "Konjaku Monogatari" (The Tale of Times Now Past), a monk of Kojima-dera Temle, Enchin founded Kiyomizu-dera to enshrine Senju Kannon (Thousand armed Avalokitesvara) after he had a nightmare and went to Otowa fall (it was described as '小島山寺' not '子嶋寺'in "Konjaku Monogatari").
sen.cmt: （『今昔物語』には「小島山寺」と見える）を、 (it was described as 「小島山寺」 not 「子嶋寺」in "Konjaku Monogatari").としました。
sen.e: According to tradition about the foundation of Kiyomizu-dera Temple described in some historical materials such as "Konjaku Monogatari" (The Tale of Times Now Past), a monk of Kojima-dera Temple, Enchin, founded Kiyomizu-dera to enshrine Senju Kannon (Thousand armed Avalokitesvara) after he had a nightmare and went to Otowa no taki Falls (it was described as '小島山寺' not 'Kojima-dera Temple' in "Konjaku Monogatari").
sen.cmt: ・Enchinの後にはコンマが必要と思われます。・カギ括弧はクォーテーションマークに変える必要があると思われます。・音羽の滝は用語集の用語に合わせました。・「小嶋山寺」は漢字の問題ではないと思いますのでスペルアウトが適切と思われます。ただし、読みが不明ですのでそのままにしています。・上記の理由で「子嶋寺」は英語表記にしました。・Temle→Templeのスペルミスです。
sen.e: According to tradition about the foundation of Kiyomizu-dera Temple described in some historical materials such as "Konjaku Monogatari" (The Tale of Times Now Past), a monk of Kojima-dera Temple, Enchin, founded Kiyomizu-dera Temple to enshrine Senju Kannon (Thousand armed Avalokitesvara) after he had a nightmare and went to Otowa no taki Falls (it was described as '小島山寺' not 'Kojima-dera Temple' in "Konjaku Monogatari").

sen.j: 諸史料に「子嶋山寺」と見えるところからも、創建当初の子嶋寺は山中に位置していたと思われる。
sen.e: Several materials descried 'Kojimayama-dera Temple', therefore, the original Kojima-dera Temple was considered to be located in mountains.
Several materials indicate 'Kojimayama-dera Temple' (literally, Kojima Mountain Temple); therefore, the original Kojima-dera Temple is considered to have been located in mountains.
sen.cmt: ・thereforeは接続詞ではないため、セミコロンでつなぐ必要があります。・was considered to beは時制が不適切なため、修正しました。・子嶋山寺の「山」のニュアンスを補足説明として加えました。・descried（スペルミス）は意味がずれるためindicateとしました。
sen.e: Several materials indicate 'Kojimasan-dera Temple' (literally, Kojima Mountain Temple); therefore, the original Kojima-dera Temple is considered to have been located in mountains.

sen.j: 子嶋寺の東南方の山中に観音院（高取町上子島）という寺がある。
sen.e: There is a temple named Kannon-in Temple located in mounatins in the southeast of Kojima-dera Temple (kamikoshima Takatori-cho).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There is a temple named Kannon-in Temple located in mountains in the southeast of Kojima-dera Temple (Kamikoshima, Takatori-cho).
sen.cmt: 住所の書き方が不適切だったため修正しました。（頭文字とコンマの使用）
sen.e: There is a temple named Kannon-in Temple located in mountains in the southeast of Kojima-dera Temple (Kamikoshima, Takatori-cho).

sen.j: この寺は山号を「子嶋山」と称し、創建縁起についても子嶋寺と同様の伝承を伝える。
sen.e: Its sango (literally, "mountain name"), which is the title prefixed to the name of a Buddhist temple, is 'Kojimayama' and its history of the foundation is similar to Kojima-dera Temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Its sango is 'Kojimayama' and its history of the foundation is similar to Kojima-dera Temple.
sen.cmt: 「山号」は初出ではないため、説明は削除しました。
sen.e: Its sango is 'Kojimayama' and its history of the foundation is similar to Kojima-dera Temple.

sen.j: そのため、子嶋寺と関連の深い寺院と思われ、創建当時の子嶋寺はこの付近にあったとも考えられている。
sen.e: Therefore, it is considered to be deeply related to Kojima-dera Temple and the original Kojima-dera Temple at the time of the foundation is considered to have been located around there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, it is considered to be deeply related to Kojima-dera Temple and the original Kojima-dera Temple at the time of the foundation is considered to have been located around there.
Therefore, it is considered to be deeply related to Kojima-dera Temple and the original Kojima-dera Temple at the time of the foundation is considered to have been located around there.

sen.j: 『子嶋山観覚寺縁起』（江戸時代中期成立）によると、子嶋寺は平安時代中期頃には一時衰退していた。
sen.e: According to "Kojimayama Kankakuji Temple engi"(completed in the middle of the Edo period), Kojima-dera Temple was on the decline in the middle of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to "Kojimasan Kankaku-ji Engi" (The history of the Kojimasan Kankaku-ji Temple) (completed in the middle of the Edo period), Kojima-dera Temple was on the decline in the middle of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 『子嶋山観覚寺縁起』は用語集の用語に合わせました。ただし、他の箇所にあるKojimayamaと整合が取れなくなります。「子嶋山」の読みが確定できないため、そのままにしています。
sen.e: According to "Kojimasan Kankaku-ji Engi" (The history of the Kojimasan Kankaku-ji Temple) (completed in the middle of the Edo period), Kojima-dera Temple was on the decline in the middle of the Heian period.

sen.j: しかし、永観元年（983年）、興福寺の僧真興が入寺して中興し、子嶋寺の子院として山下に「観覚寺」を建立し、真言宗子嶋流を始めたという。
sen.e: However, in 983, a monk of Kofuku-ji Temple, Shingyo entered the temple, revitalized it, founding 'Kankaku-ji Temple' as a branch temple of Kojima-dera Temple at the bottom of the mountain and started prevailing the Kojima school of the Shingon sect.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, in 983, a monk of Kofuku-ji Temple, Shingyo, entered the temple, revitalized it, founding 'Kankaku-ji Temple' as a branch temple of Kojima-dera Temple at the bottom of the mountain and started the Kojima school of the Shingon sect.
sen.cmt: ・Shingyoの後にはコンマが必要と思われます。・prevailingは意味がずれてしまいます。
sen.e: However, in 983, a monk of Kofuku-ji Temple, Shingyo, entered the temple, revitalized it, founding 'Kankaku-ji Temple' as a branch temple of Kojima-dera Temple at the bottom of the mountain and started the Kojima school of the Shingon sect.

sen.j: 法相宗を主として八宗兼学の寺であった子嶋寺はこの頃から真言宗の道場として栄えるようになり、「観覚寺」と称されるようになった。
sen.e: Around this timel, Kojima-dera Temple where monks practiced Hasshu Kengaku (learning eight Buddhist sects together), putting Hossoshu as a main school was thriving as a training place for the Shingon sect and it was named 'Kankaku-ji Temple'.

Around this time, Kojima-dera Temple, where monks practiced Hasshu Kengaku (learning eight Buddhist sects together) putting the Hosso sect as a main school, was thriving as a training place for the Shingon sect and it was named 'Kankaku-ji Temple.'
sen.cmt: ・timel→スペルミスです。・ピリオドは統一スタイルに従ってクォーテーションマークの中に入れました。・whereは非制限であるべきなので、コンマを入れました。・schoolの後にはコンマが必要と思われます。・puttingはHasshu Kengakuに係るべきなので、直前のコンマは不要と思われます。・法相宗は用語集の用語に合わせました。
sen.e: Around this time, Kojima-dera Temple, where monks practiced Hasshu Kengaku (learning eight Buddhist sects together) putting the Hosso sect as a main school, was thriving as a training place for the Shingon sect and it was named 'Kankaku-ji Temple.'

sen.j: 同縁起によると、最盛期の子嶋寺（観覚寺）は21の子院が立ち並び、現在の高取町と明日香村にまたがる広大な境内地をもっていた。
sen.e: "Kojimayama Kankakji Temple engi"also suggested that in its prime time, there were twenty-one branches of Kojima-dera Temple (Kankaku-ji Temple) and it had a huge precinct straddling present-day Takatori-cho and Asuka-mura.

"Kojimasan Kankaku-ji Engi"also suggested that in its prime time, Kojima-dera Temple (Kankaku-ji Temple) had twenty-one branches and a huge precinct straddling present-day Takatori-cho and Asuka-mura.
sen.cmt: ・「縁起」は用語集の用語に合わせました。・there wereの部分は、in its prime timeとの関係からも子嶋寺がくるべきなので、修正しました。
sen.e: "Kojimasan Kankaku-ji Engi"also suggested that in its prime time, Kojima-dera Temple (Kankaku-ji Temple) had twenty-one branches and a huge precinct straddling present-day Takatori-cho and Asuka-mura.

sen.j: 藤原道長の日記『御堂関白記』によれば、寛弘4年（1007年）には道長がこの寺に参詣している。
sen.e: According to "Mido Kanpakuki" (the diary of FUJIWARA no Michinaga), Michinaga visited this temple in 1007.
According to "Mido Kanpakuki" (the diary of FUJIWARA no Michinaga), Michinaga visited this temple in 1007.
According to "Mido Kanpakuki" (the diary of FUJIWARA no Michinaga), Michinaga visited this temple in 1007.

sen.j: 室町時代には子嶋寺は戦乱に巻き込まれて衰退したが、高取藩主（高取城主）の本多氏によって再興された。
sen.e: Although Kojima-dera Temple got involved in the disturbances of war during the Muromachi period and ebbed away, the lord of the Takatori Domain (the lord of Takatori Casttle), the Honda clan revitalized it.

Although Kojima-dera Temple was involved in the disturbances of war during the Muromachi period and ebbed away, the lord of the Takatori Domain (the lord of Takatori Castle), the Honda clan, revitalized it.
sen.cmt: ・gotは口語になるため、修正しました。・Casttle→Castleのスペルミスです。・Honda clanの後にはコンマが必要です。
sen.e: Although Kojima-dera Temple was involved in the disturbances of war during the Muromachi period and ebbed away, the lord of the Takatori Domain (the lord of Takatori Castle), the Honda clan, revitalized it.

sen.j: 近世以降は興福寺一乗院の支配下に入り、藩主の本多氏および植村氏によって庇護された。
sen.e: Since the Modern times, it was controlled by Kofuku-ji Temple Ichijo-in and under the patronage of the Honda clen and the Uemura clan.
Since the modern times, it was controlled by Kofuku-ji Temple Ichijo-in and under the patronage of the Honda clan and the Uemura clan.
sen.cmt: ・clen→clanのスペルミスです。・Modernは特別な意味はないので、他の部分とも合わせるためmodernにしました。
sen.e: Since the modern times, it was controlled by Kofuku-ji Temple Ichijo-in and under the patronage of the Honda clan and the Uemura clan.

sen.j: 寺号は近世には子嶋山千寿院と称されていた。
sen.e: Its jigo was Kojimayama Senju-in in the Modern times.
Its jigo was Kojimayama Senju-in in the modern times.
sen.cmt: ・Modernは特別な意味はないので、他の部分とも合わせるためmodernにしました。
sen.e: Its jigo was Kojimasan Senju-in in the modern times.

sen.j: 現存する本堂は江戸時代末期の嘉永元年（1848年）、壺阪寺から来た僧賢応によって建立されたものである。
sen.e: The existing hondo(the main hall) was built by a monk, Keno coming from Tsubosaka-dera Temple in 1848, in the end of the Edo period.
The existing hondo (the main hall) was built by a monk, Keno, who came from Tsubosaka-dera Temple in 1848, in the end of the Edo period.
sen.cmt: ・hondoの後にスペースを入れました。・Kenoの後にはコンマが必要です。・coming fromは意味が漠然としているため、関係代名詞に修正しました。
sen.e: The existing hondo (the main hall) was built by a monk, Keno, who came from Tsubosaka-dera Temple in 1848, in the end of the Edo period.

sen.j: 明治の廃仏毀釈以後、庇護者を失って再び衰退し、一時無住となった。
sen.e: Since Haibutsu kishaku (a movement that abolishes Buddhism and destroyed Buddhist temples, images and text) in the Meiji period, it declined again because it lost patronage and the monks there were drove out for some time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since Haibutsu kishaku (a movement that abolishes Buddhism and destroyed Buddhist temples, images and text) in the Meiji period, it declined again because it lost patronage and the monks were driven out for some time.
sen.cmt: ・drove→drivenが正です。・the monks thereのthereはtheで表現されているため不要です。thereがあると誤読しやすい文になります。
sen.e: Since Haibutsu kishaku (a movement that abolishes Buddhism and destroyed Buddhist temples, images and text) in the Meiji period, it declined again because it lost patronage and the monks were driven out for some time.

sen.j: しかし、地元有志によって復興され、明治36年（1903年）には千寿院を改めて「子嶋寺」に復称した。
sen.e: However, it was revitalized by local volunteers and in 1903, it was renamed from Senju-in into 'Kojima-dera Temple'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, it was revitalized by local volunteers and in 1903, it was renamed from Senju-in into 'Kojima-dera Temple.'
sen.cmt: ピリオドは統一事項に従ってクォーテーションマークの中に入れました。
sen.e: However, it was revitalized by local volunteers and in 1903, it was renamed from Senju-in into 'Kojima-dera Temple.'

tit.cmt: 意味がやや広いため、変更しました。

sen.j: 本堂
sen.e: Main hall
Hondo
sen.cmt: 原文の用語は前の文でも使われいるため使用しました。
sen.e: Hondo

sen.j: 嘉永元年（1848年）建立。
sen.e: It was built in 1848.
It was built in 1848.
It was built in 1848.

sen.j: 山門
sen.e: Sanmon (temple gate)
Sanmon (temple gate)
Sanmon (temple gate)

sen.j: 高取城二の門を移築したもので、現存する唯一の高取城遺構である。
sen.e: Its sanmon was Ninomon (the second gate) of Takatori Castle which was brought over to the site and it was the only remnant of Takatori Castle,
Its sanmon was Takatori Castle's Ninomon (the second gate), which was brought over to the site, and it is the only remnant of Takatori Castle.
sen.cmt: ・移築したのは高取城ではなくて二の門だけなので、それを明確にしました。・which was brouhgt overは非制限用法が適切なため、直前にコンマを入れました。・現存する唯一の遺構であるため、it wasではなくit isとしました。・文の終わりがコンマになっています。
sen.e: Its sanmon was Takatori Castle's Ninomon (the second gate), which was brought over to the site, and it is the only remnant of Takatori Castle.

tit.cmt: 用語集の用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 紺綾地金銀泥絵両界曼荼羅図
sen.e: Konayajikingindeie ryokaimandarazu
Konayajikingindeie ryokaimandarazu (The picture which paints the Ryokai Mandara, which means the wisdom world and the mercy world, with gold color and silver color, on the dark blue twill cloth)
sen.cmt: 用語集にある説明を加えました。
sen.e: Konayajikingindeie ryokaimandarazu (The picture which paints the Ryokai Mandala, which means the wisdom world and the mercy world, with gold color and silver color, on the dark blue twill cloth)
sen.cmt: Mandara→Mandala（統一リストにあわせました）

sen.j: 京都・神護寺の高雄曼荼羅と並ぶ両界曼荼羅図の代表作である。
sen.e: It is one of the most important works of ryokaimandarazu, being a match for takaomandara preserved in Shingo-ji Temple in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: It is one of the most important Ryokai Mandara-zu (Drawing of Ryokai Mandara), being a match for Takao mandara preserved in Shingo-ji Temple in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: ・「両界曼荼羅」は用語集の用語に合わせ、ハイフンを入れ、補足説明を加えました。・「高雄曼荼羅」は用語集に合わせ2語に分けましたが、用語集ではmandalaとなっており、他の箇所のmandaraと整合が取れていません。
sen.e: It is one of the most important Ryokai Mandala-zu (Drawing of Ryokai Mandara), being a match for Takao mandara preserved in Shingo-ji Temple in Kyoto.
sen.cmt: Mandara→Mandala（統一リストにあわせました）

sen.j: これは、子嶋寺中興の祖とされる真興 (僧)が一条天皇の病気平癒祈願の功により賜ったと伝わる。
sen.e: It is said that Shingyo (monk), who was considered to revitalize Kojima-dera Temple, received it in reward for praying for the return of the Emperor Ichijo's health.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: It is said that Shingyo (monk), who was considered to have revitalized Kojima-dera Temple, received it in reward for praying for the return of the Emperor Ichijo's health.
sen.cmt: considered to revitalizeは時制が不適切なため、修正しました。
sen.e: It is said that Shingyo (monk), who was considered to have revitalized Kojima-dera Temple, received it in reward for praying for the return of the Emperor Ichijo's health.

sen.j: （奈良国立博物館寄託）
sen.e: (deposited in Nara National Museum)
(deposited in Nara National Museum)
(deposited in Nara National Museum)

tit.cmt: 他の部分と大文字使用を合わせました。

sen.j: 木造十一面観音立像
sen.e: Mokuzo Juichimen Kannon Ryuzo (wooden standing statue of eleven-faced kannon)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Mokuzo Juichimen Kannon Ryuzo (wooden standing statue of eleven-faced kannon)
Mokuzo Juichimen Kannon Ryuzo (wooden standing statue of eleven-faced kannon)

sen.j: （東京国立博物館寄託）
sen.e: (deposited in Tokyo National Museum)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: (deposited in Tokyo National Museum)
(deposited in Tokyo National Museum)

sen.j: 近鉄吉野線壺阪山駅下車、徒歩
sen.e: Get off at Tsubosaka Station, Yoshino line, Kintetsu train and then, on foot.
Get off Kintetsu Yoshino Line at Tsubosakayama Station and walk.
sen.cmt: ・Tsubosaka Station→Tsubosakayama Stationです。・「近鉄吉野線」は用語集の用語に合わせました。・駅と線の並びは、この場合、逆が一般的のようです。・on footは動詞ではないため、walkとしました。
sen.e: Get off Kintetsu Yoshino Line at Tsubosakayama Station and walk.
